Gamelan Sekaten Keraton Surakarta Mulai Ditabuh Non Stop Sepekan
03 Nov 2019, 00:58 by Ahmad Rafiq (Kontributor), Rini Kustiani
TEMPO.CO, Solo - Keraton Kasunanan Surakarta Hadiningrat mulai menabuh sepasang gamelan sekaten, Sabtu 2 November 2019. Gamelan itu ditabuh di pelataran Masjid Agung non stop hingga sepekan ke depan.
Sepasang gamelan bernama Kyai Guntur Madu dan Kyai Guntur Sari itu akan ditabuh selama 24 jam setiap harinya. "Hanya berhenti saat Salat," kata Tafsir Anom Masjid Agung, Kanjeng Raden Tumenggung Muhtarom.
Sebelum ditabuh, gamelan tersebut dikirab dari Keraton Kasunanan Surakarta menuju Masjid Agung. Iring-iringan kirab berjalan dari Kori Kamandungan menuju Masjid Agung, melewati kompleks Siti Hinggil.
Sesampainya di Masjid Agung, mereka meletakkan perangkat gamelan di Bangsal Pradonggo yang berada di pelataran masjid tersebut. Gamelan Kiai Guntur Sari diletakkan di sebelah selatan dan Kiai Guntur Madu di sebelah utara.
Dua perangkat gamelan tersebut tidak ditabuh secara bersamaan. "Cara menabuhnya bergantian," kata Muhtarom. Gamelan itu akan terus ditabuh hingga hari peringatan Maulid Nabi Muhammad SAW pada 12 Rabiulawal Hijriyah yang tahun ini jatuh pada Sabtu, 9 November 2019.
Menurut Muhtarom, tradisi menabuh gamelan sekaten merupakan bentuk pelestarian budaya yang dipopulerkan oleh Wali Songo. "Gamelan sekaten ini menjadi salah satu bentuk syiar Islam," katanya. Tradisi tersebut wujud akulturasi budaya dan membuat Islam lebih mudah diterima oleh masyarakat pada masa itu.

Gamelan Sekaten Keraton Surakarta Starts Beating Non-Stop a Week
03 Nov 2019, 00:58 by Ahmad Rafiq (Contributor), Rini Kustiani
TEMPO.CO, Solo - Surakarta Hadiningrat Sunanate Palace began beating a pair of sekaten gamelan, Saturday 2 November 2019. The gamelan was beaten on the court of the Great Mosque non-stop for the next week.
A pair of gamelan named Kyai Guntur Honey and Kyai Guntur Sari will be beaten 24 hours a day. "It only stops during Salat," said the Great Mosque Anom Tafsir, Kanjeng Raden Tumenggung Muhtarom.
Before the beating, the gamelan was sent from Keraton Kasunanan Surakarta to the Great Mosque. The parade procession runs from Kori Kamandungan to the Great Mosque, past the Siti Hinggil complex.
Arriving at the Great Mosque, they put gamelan instruments in Pradonggo Ward in the courtyard of the mosque. Gamelan Kiai Guntur Sari is placed in the south and Kiai Guntur Honey in the north.
The two gamelan instruments are not beaten simultaneously. "How to beat it alternately," said Muhtarom. The gamelan will continue to be played until the anniversary of the Prophet Muhammad's Birthday on 12 Rabiulawal Hijriyah, which this year fell on Saturday, November 9, 2019.
According to Muhtarom, the tradition of beating sekaten gamelan is a form of cultural preservation popularized by Wali Songo. "Gamelan sekaten has become a form of Islamic symbols," he said. This tradition is a form of cultural acculturation and made Islam more easily accepted by the people at that time.
